title: Magicshine Releases the Seemee 50 Bike Tail Light
content:
A taillight is often an afterthought. Its small size means you might lose it, and poor battery life can mean you’re stuck riding without a light. A 30.5 max runtime makes the new Magicshine Seemee 50 bike light an easy choice.

The Magicshine Seemee 50 offers a max 50 lumens that are best seen on its “day flash” setting. That mode goes for up to 21 hours and helps to make you just a little bit more obvious to drivers.

Also read: The Specialized Sirrus Carbon is missing its seat tube

Besides its excellent battery life, the Seemee 50 tail light has a setting called “Group Ride.” This setting allows folks to pair together multiple lights to synchronize their flashing patterns. This requires multiple people to have a SEEMEE 50 light but is nevertheless a relatively novel idea that is exciting to see.

The Seemee 50 is fairly compact and is designed to band onto a seatpost or frame using an included silicone O-ring.  These taillights are USB-C rechargeable and offer an IPX-6 waterproof rating. Total charging time is about two hours from zero charge.

Learn more about Magicshine lights at magicshine.com.
author: Alvin Holbrook
